tit.e: Saniryo (the office controlling Sani, courtier without post)
Sanniryo (the office controlling Sanni, courtiers without a post)
tit.cmt: 原文表記に基づき、Sanniryo、Sanniに修正
tit.e: Sanniryo (the office controlling Sanni, courtiers without a post)

sen.j: 散位寮（さんにりょう）は古代日本の律令制において式部省に属する機関の一つである。
sen.e: Saniryo is one of the institutions belonging to Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial) in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in ancient Japan.
Sanniryo was one of the institutions belonging to Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial) in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: is→wasとし、原文表記に基づき、Sanniryoに修正
sen.e: Sanniryo was one of the institutions belonging to Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial) in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in ancient Japan.

sen.j: 散位寮は散位を名簿によって管理しその考課を行う。
sen.e: Saniryo controlled and evaluated Sani (courtier without post) with the name lists.
Sanniryo controlled and evaluated Sanni (courtiers without a post) with the name lists.
sen.cmt: 原文表記に基づき、Sanniryo, Sanniに修正
sen.e: Sanniryo controlled and evaluated Sanni (courtiers without a post) with the name lists.

sen.j: 官人（さんに）は散官ともいい位階のみで官職を持たないもののことをいう。
sen.e: Sanni (government official (esp. one of low to medium rank)) was also called sankan (a position which does not have specific roles) and had only Ikai (Court rank) and did not have a government post.
Sanni was also called Sankan (a position which does not have specific roles) and had only Ikai (Court rank) and did not have a government post.
sen.cmt: 原文表記に基づき、Sanniに修正、補足表記削除、sankanの頭文字を大文字に変更
sen.e: Sanni was also called Sankan (a position which does not have specific roles) and had only Ikai (Court rank) and did not have a government post.

sen.j: 京官・外官および文官・武官の別がある。
sen.cmt: 意味不明のため、訳出不可でした。
sen.e: Sanni were divided into officials in charge of the central government and those in charge of provincial governments, as well as into military officers and civilian officers.
sen.cmt: 原文「官人・官人および官人・官人の別がある。」では意味が成り立たないため、Webを調べると「京官・外官および文官・武官の別がある。」のようになっていましたので、訳しました。原文も変更しました。

sen.j: 散位の大半は退職者である。
sen.e: Most of Sani were resignees.
Most of Sanni were resignees.
sen.cmt: 原文表記に基づき、Sanniに修正
sen.e: Most of Sanni were resignees.

sen.j: 五位以上の散位は散位寮に長上（常勤）し､六位以下のうち､在京のものは散位寮に分番（交替勤務）し､他は国府に分番して､他の官司の手伝いや使者としての事務を行う。
sen.e: Sani, who was higher than goi (Fifth Rank) in the rank, worked full-time in Saniryo and among people lower than rokui (Sixth Rank) in the rank, those who were in Kyoto did bunban (shiftwork) in Saniryo, and the others did bunban in kokufu (provincial office) and helped the other government officials and attended to their business as messengers.
sen.cmt: 「六位以下」を、People lower than rokui (Sixth Rank) in the rankとしました。
sen.e: Sanni, who was higher than goi (Fifth Rank) in the rank, worked full-time in Sanniryo and among people lower than rokui (Sixth Rank) in the rank, those who were in Kyoto did bunban (shiftwork) in Sanniryo, and the others did bunban in kokufu (provincial office) and helped the other government officials and attended to their business as messengers.
sen.cmt: 原文表記に基づき、Sanniryo, Sanniに修正
sen.e: Sanni, who was higher than goi (Fifth Rank) in the rank, worked full-time in Sanniryo and among people lower than rokui (Sixth Rank) in the rank, those who were in Kyoto did bunban (shiftwork) in Sanniryo, and the others did bunban in kokufu (provincial office) and helped the other government officials and attended to their business as messengers.

sen.j: また武散位（武官）は兵部省の管理をも受ける。
sen.e: And busani (military officer without post) was controlled by Hyobusho (ministry of military).
And Busanni (military officer without post) was controlled by Hyobu-sho (the Ministry of Military).
sen.cmt: busani→Busanniとし、Shikibu-shoの表記に合わせ、Hyobu-sho (the Ministry of Military)としました。
sen.e: And Busanni (military officer without post) was controlled by Hyobu-sho (the Ministry of Military).

sen.j: その他四度使（よどのつかい）の一つである朝集使が在京中のときはその管理を行う。
sen.e: And additionally, when Choshushi (clerks conveying the Public Documents under the System of the Law "Ritsuryo"), who was one of Shidoshi, was in Kyoto, they controlled it.
And additionally, when Choshushi (clerks conveying the Public Documents under the System of the Law "Ritsuryo"), who was one of Yodo no tsukai, was in Kyoto, they controlled it.
sen.cmt: Shidoshi→原文の読みに基づきYodo no tsukaiに修正
sen.e: And additionally, when Choshushi (clerks conveying the Public Documents under the System of the Law "Ritsuryo"), who was one of Yodo no tsukai, was in Kyoto, they controlled it.

sen.j: のちに散位制度が形骸化すると存在意義が薄れ寛平八年（896年）式部省に併合され､以後散位の事務も式部省で行われた。
sen.e: Later the system of Sani became a mere façade and lost the importance of existence, and in 896 it was incorporated in Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial) and after that the office work in Sani was done in Shikibu-sho.
Later the system of Sanni became a mere façade and lost the importance of existence, and in 896 it was incorporated in Shikibu-sho and after that the office work in Sanni was done in Shikibu-sho.
sen.cmt: 原文表記に基づき、Sanniに修正、Shikibu-sho→既出のため補足削除
sen.e: Later the system of Sanni became a mere façade and lost the importance of existence, and in 896 it was incorporated in Shikibu-sho and after that the office work in Sanni was done in Shikibu-sho.
